name: factorization_squfocfrac_qs
chinese_name: 浅谈几种分解质因数方法
author: 罗思远
complexity: SQUFOF: O(n^(1/4)) expected; CFRAC: O(exp((1 + o(1))√(2 log n log log n))); QS: O(exp((1 + o(1))√(log n log log n)))
summary: The paper discusses three advanced integer factorization algorithms—SQUFOF, CFRAC, and Quadratic Sieve (QS)—that go beyond basic trial division. These methods leverage number-theoretic properties such as continued fractions, smooth numbers, and congruences of squares to efficiently decompose large integers into prime factors, making them suitable for competitive programming problems involving large numbers.
